to allow
touches on this view to add items to an existing drag session. Please refer to the aforementioned delegate method for its full

inlineContent.text: The drag interaction that called this method.
An in-progress drag session for adding items to.
The location of the person’s touch in the view’s coordinate system.
A completion block you call to add items to the drag session.
If this method is implemented, then the
counterpart method will no longer be called.
You should call the
block as soon as the items are ready. There is a system-defined
timeout before the system will treat the delegate call as returning an empty array. The
block
returns
if the drag session did add items to the session successfully, and
otherwise, to allow
clients to perform any clean-up if necessary.
Requests items to add to a drag session.
This method is the asynchronous counterpart to
If your delegate implements this method, then the system calls it and doesn’t call
Call the completion block as soon as items are ready.
If you don’t call the block before a system-defined time interval elapses, the system assumes you have no items to add to the session, as if you had called the completion block with an empty array.
The completion block returns
if the drag session added the items you supplied, and
otherwise.

abstract.text: Create a browser that renders content using an alternative browser engine.
A
subclass with features specific to browsers to enable asynchronous preparations and behaviours.
A protocol to which the drag interaction delegates conform.
The asynchronous counterpart to
to allow
touches on this view to add items to an existing drag session. Please refer to the aforementioned delegate method for its full
documentation.
Called when the drag interaction has begun, to allow the delegate to prepare for the drag session before
the system requests drag items through
Asks the delegate for the drag items to add to an in-progress drag session, in response to a user gesture to add the items.
A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A representation of an underlying data item as a person drags it from one location to another.
The interface for configuring a drag session.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
